channel.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
channel.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

image.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
image.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

item.title: Australian war crimes whistleblower David McBride jailed for six years
item.description: Eight years after Australia began investigating war crimes in Afghanistan, a whistleblower is the first to be punished.

item.title: New Caledonia: Security forces deployed, curfew imposed after violence
item.description: Buildings and cars torched after protest against constitutional amendments descends into rioting.

item.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 810
item.description: As the war enters its 810th day, these are the main developments.

item.title: NSM-20: ‘Inconsistencies’ plague US assessment on Israel’s Gaza war conduct
item.description: Advocates say Biden administration is 'bending over backwards' to avoid saying whether Israel is violating laws of war.

item.title: Lawrence Wong set to take centre stage as Singapore’s new prime minister
item.description: The 51-year-old will be sworn in as the city-state's fourth leader since 1965 in a ceremony on May 15.

item.title: US university ties to weapons contractors under scrutiny amid war in Gaza
item.description: Activists are calling attention to historical ties between universities and defence contractors linked to Israel’s war.

item.title: Key takeaways as ex-Trump lawyer Michael Cohen testifies in New York trial
item.description: Cohen testifies in former president's hush-money trial about efforts to quash negative stories before 2016 election.

item.title: Fury’s father bloodied in clash with Usyk’s entourage
item.description: Tyson Fury's and Oleksandr Usyk's entourages clash at media event before Saturday's boxing bout in Saudi Arabia.

item.title: How significant is Russia’s new military offensive in northeastern Ukraine?
item.description: Troops take control of villages and attack energy facilities in Kharkiv region.

item.title: Hezbollah says will keep fighting if Israel presses on with assault on Gaza
item.description: Hezbollah chief Nasrallah says support for Gaza is 'final', as cross-border fighting displaces thousands of people.

item.title: US students use graduation to stand with Palestine
item.description: US students disrupt graduation ceremonies to show support for Palestine

item.title: Top US Senator Bob Menendez’s corruption trial begins
item.description: Jury selection begins in trial accusing top Democrat of accepting bribes and acting as unregistered foreign agent.

item.title: Dutch faculty join student walkout after police cleared encampment
item.description: “We have a centre for genocide studies on this campus... We need our institutions to step up.”

item.title: Turkey’s Erdogan meets Greek PM, sees ‘no unsolvable problems’ in ties
item.description: On visit to Ankara, Greece's Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitotakis says leaders 'wish to intensify our bilateral contacts'.

item.title: One of the biggest hurdles for athletes on the Olympic path: Money
item.description: Full-time training, travel to compete, medical and most other costs for these athletes are out of pocket.

item.title: Palestinians flee as Israeli forces re-enter Jabalia in northern Gaza
item.description: Israel resumes attacks in Gaza's Jabalia as tanks, troops, push into southern city of Rafah amid humanitarian crisis.

item.title: Russia intensifies attacks on Ukraine’s Kharkiv region
item.description: Kyiv says Russian forces having 'tactical success' in assault on northeastern region on shared border.

item.title: Why are social media users blocking celebrities over Israel’s Gaza war?
item.description: How the Met Gala triggered a social media #Blockout2024 — a digital guillotine — against celebrities' silence on Gaza.

item.title: Energy summit seeks to curb cooking habits that kill millions every year
item.description: Harmful cooking practices result in the deaths of 3.7 million people every year with children and women most at risk.

item.title: Use of fire as weapon in Sudan war surged last month, study finds
item.description: Investigators from Sudan Witness are using open source technology to document the systematic use of fire by combatants.

item.title: Thousands evacuate as wildfire grows ‘dramatically’ in western Canada
item.description: Authorities say wind will push the Parker Lake Wildfire closer to the small community of Fort Nelson, British Columbia.

item.title: Michael Cohen heads to court to testify against ex-boss Donald Trump
item.description: Former Trump attorney Michael Cohen is set to testify against his ex-boss over hush money payments to Stormy Daniels.

item.title: Extermination, expulsion ‘identifiable strategies’ of Israel’s war in Gaza
item.description: A human rights group calls on the United Kingdom to stop arming Israel as its campaign in the strip continues.

item.title: Palestinian girl rescued from rubble after Israeli attack in Gaza
item.description: Video shows the rescue of Palestinian girl who’d been trapped under rubble after an Israeli attack in Gaza.

item.title: African countries call for sanctions as UN nears treaty on ‘biopiracy’
item.description: The UN has been working for decades on a treaty to prevent the exploitation of genetic resources.
